intro: Hyalosema leysenianum, commonly known as the Lesien's hyalosema, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its woody stems and showy, palmate leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white in color. It thrives in humid, well-drained soils and is often found in moist woodland areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
